Super easy! I found that one cup of plain cheese cake on the crust bottom was not enough to have a balanced layered look. I think at least 1.5 of plain cheese cake is needed if you are looking for the half/half look. Taste is creamy and smooth, not dense. Still prefer just a plain pumpkin pie but can't fault this cake for what it is, just a cake that tastes nice, looks nice and is easy!

None
text:
Well-received but exhausting!  I did take quite a few of the other reviewer's recommendations and came up with the recipe that worked the best for me and was to my and my families taste.  I used 3 packages of cream cheese, 8 oz. of pumpkin puree, 1.5 cups of shortbread cookie crumbs (for the crust) and added 1/2 cup of sour cream.  When making it, I folded in the sour cream right after adding the eggs to the batter.  To bake, I placed it in a water bath for 1 hour and then propped the oven door open and left it inside for 1 hour more.  Cover it with a caramel glaze and you are in business!  It does take a lot of time- but people do seem to enjoy it.  :)

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/121.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a fun and delicious alternative to pumpkin pie. I really liked the two layer aspect of it. I would not recommend using a store bought graham pie crust though - they are not usually good quality and will totally take away from the finished result. I needed a gluten free crust anyway, so chose to go with a home made almond crust which is basically ground whole almonds and butter. It was a fabulous complement to this wonderful cheesecake. Just a dollop of unsweetened real whipped cream is needed on top to keep it from being too rich overall. A tip for avoiding a cracked top on your cheesecake- use room temp cheese and eggs, and don't over beat while mixing. Also, when the cake is done, turn the oven off and leave the cake in with the door ajar, until the oven cools. You can also run a knife around the edge to loosen the cake from the sides of the pan. Then, refrigerate. Cheesecake is also best best made the day before serving.

text:
Made this for Thanksgiving and it turned out good but not quite as I expected. The crust burned slightly probably bc I had to bake it much longer since I made it thicker by upping the recipe by half - put in 3 pkgs of cream cheese, 3 eggs, used 3/4 cup pumpkin puree, etc. Otherwise it would have been a thin cheesecake. It looks pretty but I think I'll stick to the regular non-layered pumpkin cheesecakes.

text:
This recipe is awesome!!! I made this for a potluck at work at it turned out wonderful! Everyone loved it and wanted me to make it again. I brought a couple pieces home for my husband to try and as soon as he bit it, he was like "AWWWW SOO GOOD". My picky son liked it to.  I looked at all the reviews and decided to make it into bars with the 8x13 pan and wax paper on bottom as Jodi stated.  I used the same recipe above and doubled it to fit pan, but for the spices, I used the spices and amounts listed (did not double those), then added 1 heaping teaspoonful of pumpkin pie spice.  I did double the vanilla extract too to 1 tsp! I used Mrs Vela Ela Ela's graham cracker crumb recipe without nuts instead of store bought.  I cooked mine for 60 minutes on the dot, left the oven door open for 20 min (it was almost midnight, so tired), then left in the refrigerator till the next morning. I will always make this recipe forever!  Thanks!

country:
None
text:
Thanks for a really great recipe! I brought this to a pie party (exactly what it sounds like) and it was gone in 10 minutes, even though there were 15 other delicious home made pies there that the guests could eat. I followed Southernbelle's suggestion and topped the cheesecake with a homemade caramel sauce. Definitely a hit.

A tip for getting the cream cheese to room temperature for impatient people like me: place the tin-foil cheese cake packets in a bowl of hot tap water for about 5 minutes or until soft. Dump the water and dry the bowl with a dish cloth and you can use it to mix the batter without another wash. To further improve the texture, I whipped the cream cheese with a fork to insure that even the middle of the block was warm and soft before adding the other ingredients.

I can't wait to bring this to Thanksgiving! Mom's pumpkin pie has some competition this year.

text:
this recipe is DE-LI-CIOUS!  I used some tips from Southernbelle908-I used the ingredients listed in the original list but cooked in a water bath for 1hr instead, then propped open the oven and let the cheese cake cool for about 2hrs before removing it to prevent cracking.
I also modified the whip cream by making my own - 1/2 pint heavy cream (light will not work), 1 1/2TBS sugar, 1tsp vanilla.
Took this to a meeting and everyone LOVED IT! Adding this one to the box!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
My mother loves pumpkin flavored desserts and this is, by far, her favorite. She always asks me to make it whenever I can. I always use fresh pumpkin puree made from scratch. I use a japanese squash called kabocha that is very similar to a pumpkin and it has a very sweet, fiberous flesh. You can usually find it in asian supermarkets during the fall season. I cut it into quarters, bake at 400 degrees in a water bath until the flesh becomes tender and you can stick a knife into it (about an hour or so). Then I scoop out the flesh and puree it with a hand mixer. It's more work but so very worth it!

I made this using 3/4c pumpkin, 1/2c sour cream, and 1/3 less fat cream cheese. I added 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice and used splenda instead of sugar. I baked on a cookie sheet with water at 350 for 45 mins. I was hoping I'd love it, but it was really just okay. I followed the suggestions of SOUTHERNBELLE0908. This was incredible. Absolutely the best pumpkin cheesecake I've ever eaten. The only thing I might do differently next time is add a tablespoon of additional sugar or maybe a pinch of salt to balance out the addition of the sour cream. It was just a touch sour. I used a crushed gingersnap crust instead of graham cracker (which I highly recommend) and 3/4 tsp of pumpkin pie spice + 1/8 tsp ground cloves.

text:
I really liked this recipe, but I did modify it just a bit:  Increased the pumpkin to 8oz, used 1 tsp vanilla and increased the cinnamon, clove and nutmeg (just kept adding until it tasted right to me).  I think that next time I'll also increase the sugar a bit, just to cut the tangyness of the cream cheese layer a little more.  OH--also I used 1/2 cup egg beaters instead of eggs and it turned out just fine.  Very good cheesecake!  Thanks for the recipe!!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Just made this recipe with a few changes.
I made it in a 9 inch springform pan w/ my own graham cracker crust on the bottom.
Read some reviews and based off of those, used 3 8ounce packs of cream cheese, 1/2c sour cream and used pumpkin pie filling w/ spices already added (1cup).
I added in the cinnamon. Baked on 350, foil wrapped bottom set in a baking sheet w/ water.
Baked for about 55mins. A little too long so the top cracked slightly, but I don't really care about that.
Made homemade whipped cream and YUM! Tasted delicious!

Pretty darn good! I did what one of the reviewers did and added one extra cream cheese, 1 cup of sour cream, and additional spices. I also put 2 cup of the cheesecake mix in the bottom and added a sprinkling of brown sugar to the pumpkin part and added a total of 1 cup pureed pumpkin. I also made my own crust with graham crackers, butter, and white sugar. It tasted like candy after it was done and my husband was singing my praises! I made it for his birthday and he was so excited! Great recipe- doesn't even need whipped cream. Will totally make again!

Wow, this was so good! I bought the "Keebler" prepared graham cracker pie crust and as an option, I followed the directions on their packaging to brown the crust first.  For the pumpkin puree, I bought the 'store brand' pure packed pumpkin. I used all 3 spices in the recipe(all McCormick brand), but I substituted 'ground nutmeg' for 'pumpkin pie spice.' Also, I baked my cheesecake at 350 for about 1 hour.

text:
After reading a few reviews, I decided to make this pie for Thanksgiving and it was GREAT!! Creamy and rich and what I considered a perfect cheesecake! I did, however, take a few suggestions from previous users. I used pumpkin pie mix instead of the pumpkin puree, and increased it to 1 cup and added a tsp of cinnamon and 1 tsp of nutmeg. I also added a 3rd cream cheese. Used a deep dish graham cracker crust and it was great too. I took the suggestion of cooking for 1 hour then propping the oven door open and letting the pie set for one hour, NO CRACKS! So pretty! Excellent and will make every year from now on!

text:
Oh my was this good.  I made this twice in 3 days.  The first one was slightly underbaked but still great, but this one is amazing.  It needed about an extra 15 min in the oven.  No cracks!  I used pumpkin pie filling, 3/4 c sugar and pumpkin pie spice-about a teaspoon, instead of the other spices.  I also doubled the cinnamon.  I let it chill for 24 hours.  It was totally worth the wait!!!  I will definitely make again soon.  Next time I want to make my own crust and use my springform pan, though.

This is absolutely terrific and very easy to make.  I used pumpkin pie spice instead of the individual spice ingedients, and followed the advice of another reviewer who recommended adding a bit more plain cheesecake to the pie.  I would also categorize this as a triple layer dessert because if you are doing it right, you will make the whipped cream nice and thick and as important as the other two layers.  Very yummy and will make over & over.

text:
This recipe was a big hit at my familys house on Thanksgiving. I took the original recipe here and then took some of the customs forms of the recipe and put it together. Like I first doubled the recipe using a 9 inch spring formed pan and that was a perfect thickness. Then added more pumpkin actually a whole large can of pumpkin puree and added double the amount and a half of the spices.  Then the one part of the recipe I changed was the crust.  I bought Ginger snap cookies the real good ones, Stauffer's they are the original and the best and made that the crumb crust. This just was the best I have ever made!!!  Thank you so much everyone for sharing!!!

None
text:
Made it for Thanksgiving. Everyone loved it. By reading previous reviews I made some changes. I used organic pumpkin filling and did not add the cloves or nutmeg. I added 2 extra tablespoons of sugar. When pouring the layer for the cheesecake I did 1 1/2 cups instead of 1 cup, that way you can really see and taste the cheesecake. I baked it at 350 for 1 hr and left it 1 hr in the oven so that the crust would not crack. This is great for people who are not really into pumpkin pies.

text:
I just made this for Thanksgiving dessert...and it was a tremendous hit.  So much so, I didn't even get to try a single slice, so now I'm going to have to make it AGAIN...just to be able to try it! There wasn't a crumb left in the pie tins, and I doubled the recipe! I added real vanilla beans to the mixture, a little smidge extra cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg...increased baking temp to 350 and baked in a water bath and ended up with perfection! Awesome recipe...no more regular pumpkin pies in our household - ever again!

userID:
466917
Display Name:
JOANNH13
isPro:

39

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/214810.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I was not overly impressed with this recipe.  First, as other reviewers have stated, you need to add a lot more spices to have any flavor.  I doubled the spices called for and still could have used more.   Also, if you are making in your own 9" springform pan and not using a premade "tiny" crust from the store, you will need to double the recipe overall.  I used double ingredients and still came out with a pretty thin cheesecake.    For the bottom layer if you want a nice white layer to show, you'll need at least two cups of the pre-pumpkin / cheesecake only mix to start.   I used Splenda instead of sugar and found the cake was hardly sweet at all.  My parents liked this as they prefer non-sweet desserts, however I would have prefered it to be much sweeter.   Overall it was an okay recipe, but nothing that the family will be begging me to make again.
Review:

text:
I was not overly impressed with this recipe.  First, as other reviewers have stated, you need to add a lot more spices to have any flavor.  I doubled the spices called for and still could have used more.   Also, if you are making in your own 9" springform pan and not using a premade "tiny" crust from the store, you will need to double the recipe overall.  I used double ingredients and still came out with a pretty thin cheesecake.    For the bottom layer if you want a nice white layer to show, you'll need at least two cups of the pre-pumpkin / cheesecake only mix to start.   I used Splenda instead of sugar and found the cake was hardly sweet at all.  My parents liked this as they prefer non-sweet desserts, however I would have prefered it to be much sweeter.   Overall it was an okay recipe, but nothing that the family will be begging me to make again.

text:
This is an EXCELLENT pumpkin cheesecake recipe! It's easy to follow and quick to prepare. I recommend using pumpkin pie filling and adding extra pinches of cinnamon & nutmeg. It's flavorful and you aren't playing the guessing game in terms of how much of each spice to add in. From personal experience, I usually bake mine for about 1 hour, let it sit to cool and then refrigerate overnight.   It's an all-time favorite--I've made this cheesecake for the last 3 years and everyone loves it!

text:
This was awesome! I made a few changes. I used the pumpkin pie filling as previously mentioned but also used the cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg. I also added in a 1/2 c of light sour cream and folded it in after the eggs.  I was able to use Philadelphia cream cheese with 1/3 less fat and my cheesecake set up well. Lastly, I used a water bath to cook it set at 350 degrees for an hour and then let it cool with the oven cracked for an hour. I forgot to put the cool whip on but it was gobbled up regardless!!!

text:
Great recipe! I made a graham cracker crust with a pinch of cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. I made a few changes the second time around and it came out even better. I used the entire can of pumpkin puree, doubled the spices and vanilla extract, and beat the mixture until it was lump free and very smooth. I mixed everything up instead of doing the double layer and it came out much more like a real cheesecake. Thank you for sharing!

text:
This was my first time making a cheesecake, let alone a pumpkin cheesecake. It came out sensational! My bf and I can't stop eating it.  I bought the puree but used pumpkin spice instead of buying spices separately. It made the process easier. I didn't have time to make my own crust, so I bought a prepared crust baking pan. Still came out great.  You definitely need to set the cream cheese at room temperature.  30 minutes wasn't enough time for the pie to bake fully. I left mine in the oven for 45 minutes. Very tasty. Will be making this for thanksgiving!

I gave this 5 stars because it is SO easy to make, not too time consuming and tastes great!  This is a solid recipe to take to a picnic, party or for a holiday.  It's not a gourmet recipe; but, it is a definite crowd pleaser.  The flavor is nice and light and the whipped topping really adds a nice touch.  I used Cool Whip and have been adding the topping just before serving a slice as I made this for the family and it is being eaten over a few days time.  I will definetly make this one again!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have to say that this is one of my favorite cheesecakes to make, especially for the holidays.  When I make it, I like to melt about 3 tbsp of butter in a pan (on low heat), add about 8 oz. of chopped walnuts, sprinkle with about 1/4-1/2 cup of brown sugar with a dash of cinnamon, and brown for about 10 minutes.  Add half of this mixture in between the layers of the cheesecake, then put the rest of the mix on top of the cheesecake after about 15 minutes of baking...AMAZING.

text:
Ah, This is a really good cheesecake. I was sure to use room temperature cream cheese and I actually made a homemade graham cracker crust out of Trader Joe's thick cinnamon graham crackers to go with it.  I had to bake this around 50 minutes before it was finished. Then I let it sit in the oven for a while, then the fridge over night. What amazed me was as the week went on, the taste got even better and better and soon it was SO DELICIOUS i was amazed I had even baked something so good! Around the third day!  Another plus about this recipe was how easy it was to bake... The whole thing (making the crust, and making the cheesecake) only took about 20 mins!!! I am making this again for Christmas dinner with family.

text:
I am always on the look out for low-sugar recipes since my husband and I both have had gastric bypass surgery.  I substituted 1/2 cup Splenda for the sugar.  I followed some of the other reviewers' advice and increased the cream cheese to 3 pkgs and added a little more pumpkin for flavor.  Next time I might use the less fat version of the cream cheese to lower the fat content a bit.  I also baked it sitting in a cookie sheet with water and it turned out great!  Next time I'm thinking of trying different flavors in the top layer using sugar-free instant pudding...perhaps banana...chocolate?

text:
I made this for Thanksgiving this year instead of the standard pumpkin pie.  It turned out very good.  It is not a very sweet dessert, especially compared to the other desserts I made (pecan pie and chocolate chess pie.)  After taking a bite of one of the other desserts and then trying the cheesecake, the first bite or two of the cheesecake tasted almost sour in comparison.  So if you are looking for a sweet dessert, you may want to try something else, or add more sugar to this one.  I ended up with more pumpkin layer than I could fit in my pie pan, so I think I will try making a crustless pumpkin dessert next weekend with the leftovers.  It was simple to make and a nice change from the standard pumpkin pie.

text:
This turned out wonderfully and I received rave reviews. I did make a few changes: I made my own graham crumb crust, which included some pecans, I just 1 cup of pumpkin and twice as much cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla (I forgot the cloves altogether). I used 1.5 cups of cream cheese for the bottom layer. I ended up with slightly too much for a 9 inch pie crust. I baked for 40 minutes, in a shallow pan of water, and then let the pie sit in the oven (with the door slightly open) while the oven cooled down...no cracking at all. I sprinkled the top with crushed gingerbread cookies.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Oh wow!! What a fantastic spin on cheesecake and on pumpkin pie! This had just the right amount of both. I added a bit more cream cheese (about 5 ounces?) than called for, and I thought it was perfect. I used fat free and reduced fat (a little of both) cream cheese, and you could not tell any difference. I added a layer of reduced fat Cool Whip, but I could take that or leave it - it didn't have much affect. I made my own graham cracker crust using a recipe from this site, and it was superb. I may try a mixture of graham cracker and gingersnap crust next time. I baked this in a 9" springform pan at 350F in a water bath for 60 minutes and then turned off the oven and opened the oven door and let it sit for an additional hour in the water bath. It was cooked perfectly throughout and did not crack. This sat in my refrigerator for 3 days before consumption, but the quality was unaffected. I will make this time and time again, I'm sure!!

country:

text:
Easy & Delicious pumpkin cheesecake recipe. I tweaked it a little bit. add 1/2 tsp more vanilla extract , 1/2 tsp more of cinnamon,  1/4 cup more of sugar, 1 cup more of pumpkin puree and 1 more package of cream cheese. Also, this made for 2 cheesecakes. So i used 2-9inch prepared graham cracker crusts.  Baked it for 1 hour. turned the temp off, opened the door and let the cheesecakes sit for 30 minutes. removed them from oven and let sit on counter for 1 hour. Then refrigerated for 4 hours. No cracks! beautiful presentation with the 2 layers..and soo freakin good! will be making more often not just thanksgiving. A must try!!

text:
omg.  Made this last night and set to chill for Thanksgiving dinner this evening, but my husband HAD to "test" it this morning (how embarassing, so there will be ONE piece missing when it's served, but that's find because it will show the layers).... and I should have made TWO because I could eat all of it myself! it was so delicious!  Like another reviewer said, I will never make regular pumpkin pie again!  For beginners (like me) just use 3/4 cup Libby's pumpkin pie mix instead of the puree + spices. Makes it much easier! I did also increase to 1 tsp vanilla and the 1/2 cup PLUS 2 TBS sugar - of course after reading most of the reviews.  Can't wait for dinner tonight!

text:
Excellent!  I made it by the directions the first time this weekend and it was gobbled up without me even getting a slice.  So I made one today to bring into work, this time I used a bit more cheesecake on the bottom layer to even out the layers since the pumpkin layer was so thick on the first one, and used a whole tsp. of vanilla and a bit more nutmeg and cinnamon.  Next time (thanksgiving day) I am going to try it with Pumpkin Pie Filing and see how it works.  However, for pumpkin pie lovers and cheesecake fans this is a delicious recipe and I am sure I will be making it for years to come, it was a hit!

Really good recipe. I used 3 egg whites instead of the 2 whole eggs. I also ran out of cream cheese I only had 12 oz of cream cheese I substituted the other 4 oz with ricotta cheese. I used fat free cream cheese. I added a layer of pecans. For some reason at the grocery store I went to the whole pecans were less expensive than the chopped. I chopped them up at home. I then drizzled caramel topping onto to it and a layer of whipped cream. I used the caramel ice cream topping. It came out delicious.

Soooo good!  I made some changes as per previous reviewers.  1. I used three blocks of cream cheese 2. I added all-spice, lots of cinnamon and 1/4 cup of sugar to my pumpkin puree 3. I added 1/2 cup of sour cream after I added the eggs.  Instead of the white layer on the bottom, I swirled it on top.  It looked and tasted soooo amazing!  So creamy and rich my family was convinced I bought it.  I also made my own crust (a box of ginersnaps and 1/4 cup of melted butter.  Baked in the oven for 10 minutes.

text:
Bf adores cheesecake, so him liking it is a no brainer.  He liked it; so did I (I'm not a cheesecake fan at all).  I revered the directions a bit; I really didn't want a tiny bit of cheesecake layer with a large pumpkin layer, so I mixed about 1  cup of the cheese filling in with the pumpkin mixture and put teh remaining cheese mixture on as a layer.  I ended up with about equal layers.  My layers were very small bc I used a springform pan, but that's okay.  The way the bf eats cheesecake, it's probably better to have smaller slices!  Thanks for the recipe!

Amazing recipe! Even folks in my house that aren't partial to pumpkin fell in love with this cheesecake. I followed SPRING1ONU's advice and used pumpkin pie filling. I will absolutely make this again.

text:
I'm not a cheesecake fan but I found this recipe pretty good.  Everyone that tried it loved it. I did make a few changes.  I didn't use a prepared graham crust; I made my own grinding honey graham then adding melted butter (Graham cracker crust 2) is the recipe that I used.  I also used 1 cup of pumpkin puree and half a cup of sour cream to ease the saltiness in the cream cheese.  I served my cheesecake with whipped cream and an amazing sauce taken from(Pumpkin Cookies V) recipe which in that recipe is the glaze.  That gave it a nice kick.

None
text:
This was SO good and SO easy.  I cheated and used a prepared crust.  Batter was not quite enough, might need to increase it by 1/3 or so to fill up the pie pan - if I had made the crust from scratch and used a springform pan, would have needed to double it probably.  I cooked at 325 for about 40 minutes and then allowed it to cool in the oven (off) with the door open for an hour.  Then allowed it to completely cool before refrigerating it.  The center should jiggle like jello and the pie should be firmer on the edges - done!

This was fantastic!! I used the suggestions of Southernbell, and added an extra package of cream cheese and sour cream at the end. I also added an additional 2 TBSP Sugar. I had planned to bake this in a water bath, but found out too late that my 10 in Springform wouldn't fit in my largest baking dish. I ended up baking as written, and although it cracked on the top, after adding the whipped cream topping, no one noticed. 
My mother-in-law (who is not know for offering compliments) thought it was great and even asked for the recipe. Thanks for sharing!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was wonderful, although I did change it.  The filling I made 1.5 times the recipe, added more pumpkin than called for and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg and 1/4 allspice instead of cloves.  I also used a gingersnap cookie crust with almonds which I felt went better with the pumpkin flavor.  Then instead of layering it I pulled out the plain as said and I used it to marble it to make it look prettier.  I filled the crust with the pumpkin and then dropped spoonfuls of the regular and dragged a butter knife through it.  I baked for 55 minutes then turned the oven off and left it in to cool so that it wouldn't crack.  It was beautiful and tasted phenominal.  Big hit at our Thanksgiving party!

text:
I made this to take to my in laws Thanksgiving dinner and it was a big hit!  Very easy to make and it turned out perfectly!  I followed some of the tips from others and used 3 8 ounce packages of cream cheese and 1/2 cup of sour cream added after the eggs are beaten in.  It is definitely a cheesecake with a mild pumpkin flavor...so if you dont like cheesecake, don't try it.  I got some Cool Whip to serve with it, but it really didn't need it.  Wonderful texture.  My husband is not a big fan of pumpkin pie, but he thought it was delicious.  Thanks for a wonderful recipe I will make again and again.

text:
YUM!  I followed this recipes with the exception of using canned pumpkin pie and adding the extra spices.  For alittle decoration on the top I swirled a tsp amount of left over pumpkin pie mix in 4 or 5 different spots.  My husband commented that they looked like leaves.  I wouldn't put too much in one spot as it can lead to cracking.  This dessert did very well in my son's boyscout auction!  I also made one for our family with a regular pie crust and it was very tasty.  DO TRY!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cheescake is delicious if you love pumpkin pie and cheesecake, however I have a few suggestions.  Rather than using a regular pie plate (I made my own graham cracker crust), I would use a springform pan and more pumpkin cheescake filling.  It came out rather low for a cheesecake (despite the picture), maybe an inch high.  I didn't read many reviews before baking, but I am sure people have mentioned soaking the pie, still in pan, in a warm water bath to help release it when slicing. It also takes quite a bit of time for actual eating so I recommend baking it the night before eating.  Other than time and cake height, it was quite tasty.

I made this recipe and it was a disaster - but I think it was mostly my fault. I also followed the cooking instructions and the bottom was burnt black so it was unedible. Next time I'll use canned pumpkin, double the middle and turn down the heat.

DELISH!  I usually don't like anything pumpkin.  I used 3 packages of cream cheese and one can of pure pumpkin.  Then after it had cooled for an hour with the oven door open, I pour a caramel sauce from this site over the top.  I served with whipped topping and my guests thought they were in heaven.  It's not too 'pumpkiny' so don't be afraid to make it if you aren't a fan like me.

This is a pretty good and easy recipe. But, I definitely think the pumpkin mixture needs more spices. Where it says "a pinch" - figure on using at least 1/4 tsp. if not more. I would also recommend wiping the knife blade in between each cut you make when serving so that the layers don't smear and it makes for a nicer presentation.

text:
Cheesecakes have always been one of the toughest deserts to make (in my opinion).  This one was pretty easy and turned out great tasting, but was a little hard to cut neatly... maybe I didn't cook it quite long enough?  The top cracked, but it still looked good.  It has a consistency somewhere between a pumpkin pie and a cheesecake.
I thought about making it in my springform pan like others suggested, but opted for a regular 9 inch pie plate.  The batter filled the pie plate and then some, so there is definitely no need to multiply the recipe for more thickness.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was delicious and so easy a cheesecake novice like me could do it!  I made it in a springform pan I thought was 9", but may have been bigger?  The cheesecake layer wasn't super thick, so I might make 1.5x the recipe for next time.  With only 1c of the non-pumpkin layer, it was so thin you almost didn't see it.  No matter, this amazing cheesecake looked gorgeous, didn't crack (seriously, I didn't do anything special), and was devoured at Thanksgiving.  It's not overly pumpkin-y, so the anti-pumpkin spice crowd still enjoyed it.  Make your own graham cracker crust from the recipe on here.  I also made my own pumpkin puree by baking a small sugar pumpkin and then pureeing it.  It may have added a little extra moisture that kept it from cracking, I'm not sure.  I just can't say enough how delicious this turned out.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/4989119.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made it today, only what I changed is pumpkin mix. I bough whole pumpkin after Halloween, it was on sale 50 cents. So instead of buying a canned pumpkin mix ( found out on the news it's not really a pumpkin mix it's just different zucchini's inside with pumpkin mix seasoning). So I cut pumpkin in half, scrap all the seeds out and bake at 350° cut sides down on baking dish covered in foil for 40 minutes. let it cool. Then I scrap all the pumpkin insides out separate the skin and blend it with hand mixer, ya can use food processor if ya have any. Then I used 1/2 cup of it in this amazing recipe. The rest I just put it in the freezer in plastic bowl for maybe a pumpkin pastry, who knows it yummy dishes. The smell is amazing and used all the baking pumpkin as a substitute for canned pumpkin in this recipe.. also I'll be making my own coconut whipped cream on Thanksgiving to top it on my pumpkin pie. You can find coconut whipped cream on all-time recipes too. This pie is heaven, I took a small bite, my hubby loves it too. This recipe is amazing and easy to make. Will make it again. ??

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5323213.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe! I added 1/2 cup more cream cheese, 1/3 cup sour cream, 1/4 more pumpkin, and 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice. I've found these modifications elevate the cheesecake texture and the pumpkin-pie flavor. Both times I made it I got tons of compliments and it really came out beautifully.

I made sure all ingredients were room temperature, mixed until just blended, baked with a water pan beneath the cheesecake, and let the cheesecake sit in the oven with the door slightly open until it cools. This ensured no surface cracking and perfect texture!

text:
Wow! This recipe is a keeper! I did as an earlier reviewer suggested and mixed 1 cup of cheese mixture with pumpkin puree, and put the remaining cream cheese mixture into a baked Graham  cracker crust (homemade using cinnamon Graham cracker crumbs). I also doubled the pumpkin puree for more pumpkin flavor.  Baked in a water bath and then shut the heat and opened the oven door a crack to let temperature slowly return to room temp. There were no cracks in the top.  The layers displayed beautifully and guests raved about it.  Thank you for sharing this delicious recipe.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made it in a Pyrex pie plate with fresh pumpkin puree from a cooking pumpkin.  Used a cast iron pot with water in it to keep the oven humid.  Very rich, of course.  
The pumpkin layer was nice but I don't think that the plain cheesecake layer did anything for the dessert and I probably wouldn't make it as a double layer cheesecake in the future.  

The cream cheese tends to overwhelm the spicing and I would therefore increase the spices another time.  

Summary:  Double the pumpkin, double (at least) the spices and make as a single layer dessert.

userID:
24669795
Display Name:
JuliaBrogdon
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
1
favoritesCount:
5
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674146.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I used 3 cream cheeses (8oz), added an extra egg, and more vanilla and sugar. I took out one cup of the plain batter and added it with one cup pumpkin pie filling plus some pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon. I then took out a tiny bit of the plain cheesecake batter maybe 1/3 cup and put it into a small ziploc bag. I filled a 10 inch pie crust with the remainder and stuck it in the freezer for a few minutes, then topped gently with the pumpkin batter. I cut the tip of the ziploc and piped circles on top then used a toothpick to drag the batter. Baked for about an hour sitting in a sheet pan of water. Let it cool with the door open and oven off for another hour then stuck it in the fridge for a couple hours.

5

Review:
Rating:

dateLastModified:

helpfulCount:
0
userID:
22887160
Display Name:
AF3495
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
8
favoritesCount:
19
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6113997.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Used TRindell recipe to a point.
I made Gluten free double layer cheesecake.

2 1/2- 3 cups Pamela's Gluten Free Graham crackers( you can use any gluten free brand, but these taste the best)
About 9 Tbsp butter (melted).
1/3 cup white sugar, 
1 tsp Cinnamon.
Press mixture into 10inch springfoam pan. Place in freezer until ready to use.

Full big pan with 1 inch water place on bottom rack. (So the water heats up with the oven)
Preheat oven to 350°F

3, 8oz cream cheese blocks (room temperature)
3/4 cup white sugar (heaping)
1 Tbsp vanilla, 
3 Large eggs (beaten in a separate bowl) slowly added to mixture,
1/2 cup sour cream (room temperature, add after the eggs).
Pour 2 cups of batter into springtime pan.
Then mix
1 heaping cup pumpkin puree,
1 Tbsp pumpkin pie spice. 
To remaining batter.
Pour into pan.
Beat againt counter to level.
Wrap bottom of  pan with foil so water won't get in.
Place into water bath. 
Bake for 1 hour (maybe and 1 hour and 20ish minutes. I have a fear of things not being done.)

Turn oven off and prop open oven. And cool for 30 minutes/to an hour
Place on counter and cool until pan is cool.
Wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
I left mine in all night (about 12hours)
Then I unclipped pan and took cheesecake out.
No cracks!
The cheesecake was delicious! Perfect balace of pumpkin. 
I will definitely make this again. It may even become my holiday staple.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2018-12-23T23:29:55.583

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/889660.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I make this every year and it's a favorite even with people who don't like pumpkin pie, but I did make changes based on others' suggestions.  3 (8 ounce) packages of cream cheese, stir in a 1/2 cup of sour cream, 1 (8 oz) can of pumpkin puree,  1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, slightly more sugar, but not 3/4 cup, then I doubled (or tripled depending on the taste) of the ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg. I didn't have cloves so I used ground pumpkin pie spice. I baked it in a water bath about 1 hour in the oven, then opened the over door and let it cool for an hour. No cracks!  I made my own crust of 1 1/2 cup of gingersnap cookies, 3/4 cup hazelnuts (all ground up in processes), 3 tbsp of brown sugar, 6 tbsp of melted butter and pressed the mixture into the bottom and side of the pan (greased and floured).

text:
I'm not a big pumpkin pie fan but I love cheesecake and thought this would satisfy everyone as a perfect Thanksgiving dessert! I followed the recipe exactly except I left out the nutmeg (it's actually toxic, look it up!) and I had to cook it an additional 10 minutes. It was absolutely delicious!! So easy to make and so so good. I have to say, the leftover pie tasted even better after being in the fridge another day or two. It's the perfect fall dessert and the perfect balance between cheesecake and pumpkin pie flavors. I will definitely make this one again.

text:
Meh. This really didn't do it for me or my family. It's a dessert with a personality disorder -- it's not really a cheesecake and it's not really a pie. It doesn't know what it wants to be and winds up being mediocre. There's about as much pumpkin flavor as if you'd just waved the pumpkin can over the mixing bowl, but not added any. I nearly doubled the amount of pumpkin and it was still hugely disappointing. Not a keeper if a pumpkin dessert is the goal.

text:
This was surprisingly sweet for only half a cup of sugar.  I think I'll use a third of a cup next time.  This recipe is nice and easy to put together, however I feel like the bake time is wrong.  Mine took 15 additional minutes, for a total time of 1hr at 325.  I actually had to throw away the first pie I made because it was too undercooked.   But aside from it being a touch too sweet and needing longer to bake this is a good pie that everyone loved at Thanksgiving dinner.  I will make it again, only tweaked.

text:
For ease (because I was asked to make desserts 30 hours before the event) I used leftover sugar pumpkin and added a little sweet potato to make the full amount. I also did not bother to layer the pie as I didn't have time to fiddle with it.  Baked as written in a GF cracker crust and after 45 minutes the pie and the filling sample were still goopy. As I was raising the temp for the next dessert to 400 already, I popped both back in for 15 more minutes as the temp raised. Perfect! As the pie fell with overnight refrigeration, it gained a more cheesecake like texture over an airy souffle. Both were great. I'd serve this hot OR cold.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I always make the original recipe first.  It was a hit.. but after i took other reviewers suggestions.

Double the cheesecake put portion off to side and swirl on top before baking

4 packages of cream cheese
1.5 cups sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla
4 eggs

Refrigerate cheesecake portion overnight

I also make my own crust
Graham cracker crust recipe
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs* (9 whole Graham Crackers = 1.5c/crumbs)
1/4 cup light brown sugar, loosely packed
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
Instructions:
Place GC crumbs, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt in processor
Pour the melted butter/blend
press into pan or pie tin
bake at 375* 5min

text:
Used a 9” springform pan and baked about 55 mins before it was jiggly but kind of a stiff jiggle. Let it rest and the doneness was perfect. I used about 1/8 tsp of the clove and nutmeg and made sure not to whip air into the filling. The pumpkin flavor did not dominate the cheesecake and the texture is definitely cheesecake. My 2 yr old couldn’t get enough! While I would have preferred a thicker filling because it was so good, I think the 1” thickness worked out well.

text:
Delicious! So good I made it for Christmas (night before) then I made another one (again a day in advance) to bring up to my mom-in-laws. I followed others instructions and added 1.5 cups of cream cheese mixture with 1 tsp of vanilla (3 bricks total) at the bottom, then used 1 cup of pumpkin with more of all spices. I used a spring form 9” pan, baked for one hour at 325 and left in oven until cool. Still cracked a but was perfectly cooked. Left overnight in the fridge and it was restaurant quality the next day when served (as per my family) Yum! :)

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614261.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cheesecake is really good. It’s creamy, and the baker controls the pumpki-ness and spices by using puree instead of the pie mix. I live in GB, so I made some alterations for convenience. I used digestive biscuits, which are similar to graham crackers, and I used the Graham Cracker Crust I recipe on allrecipes for the crust. The cream cheese comes in 300g tubs, so I used a total of about 20oz of cream cheese and three eggs (they weren’t very big) for the filling. I measured out 1/2 c of pumpkin puree, considered using more and decided against it. DH thought it was less-pumpkin-y than the first time I made the recipe and liked the flavor better. Also, I don’t have ground cloves, so I use garam masala whenever ground cloves are called for. I made this cheesecake for Thanksgiving and again for Christmas. It’s a keeper recipe.
Review:
Rating:
5

userID:
14516382
Display Name:
Sandy Matthews
isPro:
False
followersCount:
6
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
21
favoritesCount:
898
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1587692.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have made this twice--the first time, exactly to the written recipe (I decided this needed modification); the second time was absolutely wonderful.  What I changed--3 8oz packages of cream cheese, 1/4 cup of sugar (I used Stevia), 3 eggs added in one at a time, and a teaspoon of vanilla, beat throughly.  Put approximately one cup each of this mixture into 2, 9 inch, pre-made graham cracker pic crusts.  Then add one 16 oz can of pumpkin puree + spices, and mix again.  Divide this into 2 equal parts, and top the pies with this mixture.  Bake as instructed.  This method made a much firmer pie, more like a New York Cheesecake.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2017-11-12T19:46:36.407
helpfulCount:

I have made this twice--the first time, exactly to the written recipe (I decided this needed modification); the second time was absolutely wonderful.  What I changed--3 8oz packages of cream cheese, 1/4 cup of sugar (I used Stevia), 3 eggs added in one at a time, and a teaspoon of vanilla, beat throughly.  Put approximately one cup each of this mixture into 2, 9 inch, pre-made graham cracker pic crusts.  Then add one 16 oz can of pumpkin puree + spices, and mix again.  Divide this into 2 equal parts, and top the pies with this mixture.  Bake as instructed.  This method made a much firmer pie, more like a New York Cheesecake.

text:
I made this exactly as written, grating my nutmeg from a nut, and taking the berries from the top of whole cloves and grinding it myself using a mortar and pestle. Using these totally fresh spices might be why this is MOST DELICIOUS pumpkin cheesecake I have ever tasted. My neighbors want me to make some for them (and pay me for them) so I just printed the recipe and gave them that instead. This is SO EASY to make, and so impressive. This is the best recipe I've tried from this site, and believe me I've made a lot.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
So, I saw this recipe and wanted to try it for the guests I was having over tonight. I had all the ingredients but no time. I had 45 min til I needed to leave the house. No graham crackers or graham cracker crust, so I quick-smashed a bunch of vanilla wafers, melted some butter and mixed it in the pie pan, not nearly enough butter but kinda shaped it into a crust. Speedily mixed up everything else and somehow managed to get in in the oven in 13 minutes. Had to pull it out right at 30 min in the oven and threw it straight into the fridge. Pulled it out to eat (without whipped topping) about 7 hours later and it was perfect! Maybe a tad bit softer than it should have been, but it tasted amazing!!!! This recipe is so forgiving. Still can't believe how quickly it pulled together! Only suggestion is to add a bit more pumpkin. SO delicious!

I made this for the second time yesterday. It's a great recipe that needs minimal changes. I made my own crust using a recipe from this site, fresh pumpkin purée, a little less than 1/2 cup sugar and a rounded 1/2 teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice since I was out of the individual spices.  I prefer it without whip cream and bake it a little longer. No water bath or anything special needed.

text:
This is an awesome recipe! One step I added was to stick the pie into the freezer after the first layer, until just firm to help create an even layer and easily spread the pumpkin layer. I also added a bit more vanilla and a bit of ground ginger. The first time I made it the crust was a little crisp, so the second attempt I placed it in a shallow pan with a hot water bath. Even better result. Definitely a crowd pleaser.

text:
I made this and it was my first time making a cheesecake. I love cheesecake it's my fav dessert so I believe I know a good one when I taste it. I changed a few things I used 3/4 cup sugar, 3/4 cup pumpkin purée, 1tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp apple pie spice. It was delicious and not too sweet I had an extra 2oz of cream cheese as well. Smooth creamy and no cracks. I would definitely make again. Everyone in my family ate 2nds and 3rds there was no cheesecake left.

text:
Yum!! Used 2.5 packages of Greek yogurt-style cream cheese (had 1/2 package left over from another recipe), added about 1/2 cup sour cream after the eggs, and this gave me enough filling to have 1.5 cups of vanilla filling in the bottom of the graham cracker pie crust. Then, after it was all assembled, the key was to cook the pie at 325 deg F for about 40 minutes, or until the temperature of the filling was 150 degrees (measured on a digital thermometer in the middle of the pie).

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this cheesecake for Thanksgiving (2016) & it was a huge hit!  Absolutely delicious...the cheesecake was light (which was great following a heavy dinner) and the pumpkin flavors shined through!
After reading a number of reviews prior to cooking, I ended up adding  more than the 1/2 cup of pumpkin purée...using closer to a cup....I also used a heavy amount of Pumpkin Spice mix along with cinnamon. The overall taste was more Pumkin Pie than Cheesecake...simply divine!
[I also garnished the top with a dollop of whip cream, from a can..and then a sprinkle of cinnamon on top of the cream.]
Have a feeling I'll be asked to make this recipe again, and again, and again :)

text:
To the person who left one star. Sorry but you simply do not know how to bake!! If you make this correctly it is a smash. Always the favorite dessert where ever I bring it or serve it and I been making this for years now. I do add one teaspoon of vanilla, but always add more vanilla in all baking recipes, and TS of cinnamon and a little more of the nutmeg as well. A smash hit. So again anyone who gave this a bad rating you simply are doing something completely wrong. And if you can not make this simple recipe and get 5 star raves for years like I have you need to give up baking all together. It is really good with some caramel poured on top with cool whip. Makes it even better served that way and served ice cold. :)

None
country:
None
text:
Delicious! I'm not a huge plain pumpkin pie fan, but I do love any flavor of cheesecake and this one is perfect for fall. I have made it several times and it has been requested by family a few times. I am now really into using my pressure cooker and it makes cheesecakes so easy and they cook perfectly even. I use a Pyrex 7 cup dish and cook it on high in my pressure cooker for 25 minutes and then let it sit for 10 minutes to let the pressure release  before I take the cover off. Super fast and easy!
For the crust I just use 5 graham crackers, 1 tbsp of sugar, and 3 tbsp of melted butter.

city:

country:
None
text:
Really Good! I did do some modifications such as using a whole 15oz. can of pumpkin; pinch of ginger; tsp. pumpkin pie spice as well as the listed spices according to the recipe. 2 1/2 bricks cream cheese and rest according to directions. I didn't 'blend in' the pumpkin; I used the mixer. Came out with a MUCH thicker consistency so, naturally I was worried it wouldn't turn out. Baked for 50 mins.; let rest in oven; cooled on wire rack; refrigerated overnight & voila! it came out great. Not too sweet, good consistency. I'm glad I used the whole 15 oz. can because the cream cheese seemed to overtake. I tend to cook/bake according to taste. My family like it & their tough ;)

I made this the first time exactly as written. we all loved it. So quick and easy. 2nd x I used the pie filling as some was accidentally bought and opened and I wanted to use it up. Great again. 3rd time I couldn't find a recipe to use up some very over ripe bananas so instead of pumpkin, used 2 over ripe bananas, changed the vanilla to almond and maple, added some cinnamon and gently swirled in some melted peanut butter careful not to go too deep so the bottom layer didn't get mixed in...OMG what a fantastic and versatile easy cheesecake recipe. They all turned out amazing and were gone before I could say "want a piece of..."

text:
This is a great recipe! I turned this into individual cheesecakes by dividing everything into muffin tins. (I made a graham cracker crust also from this website) and baked them for 25 minutes. The only thing I added to the recipe was a squeeze of lemon into the cheesecake batter (before dividing and adding the pumpkin and spices).  The flavor was amazing and my family loved them! I will definitely be making these again!

text:
This was a tasty cheesecake and very easy.  I followed TRindle's advice and made it in a 9x13 pan, doubling the filling.  Don't repeat my mistake: I misread TRindle's use of waxed paper thinking "yeah, I can just lift the whole thing out of the pan if I line it with waxed paper first".  It did not lift out, and now I know that TRindle meant to say to use the waxed paper to press down the crust.  At any rate, this was a delicious cheesecake and I made the batter just as listed.

text:
Let me start off by saying that taste wise, this recipe is 5 stars. The recipe instruction really needs to be clarified. This is the first cheesecake I've ever made, so I followed the recipe exactly, even buying the expensive spices separately instead of using pumpkin pie spice like other reviewers stated they've used. I placed it in the middle rack of the oven for 40 mins, and it was not nearly enough. it looked watery and way too jiggly, so I kept it in for 20 more mins. I let it cool then put it in the fridge overnight, and it turned out fine, no problem with cracks or anything. Will definitely make again!

text:
AAAAHHHH-MAZING! My first homemade pumpkin pie / cheesecake! I made this for a Thanksgiving birthday cake and everyone loved it. There were absolutely no left-overs.  I took many reviewer's changes into account.  Used 3 packages of cream cheese, 3/4 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and 3/4 cup Pumpkin Pie Mix.  I preferred a more cheesecake taste so that's why I added more cheese and less pumpkin.  It was not too pumpkin-y nor too rich. Just perfect! I also made a delicious caramel topping which was a great addition! I would definitely recommend drizzling caramel over the top rather than a whipped cream topping. Will be making again and again!

text:
Everyone I made this for LOVED it! Took notes from other reviews: upped sugar to 1 cup, vanilla to 1 tsp, pumpkin puree to 8 oz, cinnamon to 1 tsp, nutmeg to 1/2 tsp. Used 1 pkg of normal cream cheese and 1 pkg of 1/3 less fat cream cheese and texture still was fine. Family said they were a fan because it was lighter than normal cheesecake, not too sweet even with added sugar, and could taste the pumpkin flavor. Baked it for 50 minutes (had small cracks at the top)

Definitely will be my go-to contribution for anything n autumn because of how quick and easy it is to make.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Tastes better than these $30 double layer pumpkin cheesecakes that go like hotcakes every fall at a farmer's market in NY.  Now I can make it myself!  Prior to making this recipe, I only made cupcakes out of a box for my kids' birthdays.  I read about 60 reviews and incorporated a few repeated tips that resulted in a tasty masterpiece.  I kept the recipe exactly as printed with the following tweaks: (1) to the 16 oz of cream cheese I added a half cup of whipped cream cheese (all I had in fridge); (2) I added larger quantities of flavor, i.e.,  2/3 TB of vanilla extract, 2/3 cup pumpkin purée, 2/3 tsp cinnamon, 2/3 cup sugar.  It was a hit at dessert time on Turkey Day.  My days of trekking to the faraway farmer's market for a $30 9-inch pumpkin cheesecake are over! Incredible recipe!

text:
Loved it!  So did the whole fam, young to old.  The changes I made, and want to remember, are as follow:  after placing the pre-pumpkin batter over the graham crust in spring form pan, I added an additional egg, as well as one-half cup heavy whipping cream in addition to the pumpkin.  I blended the mixture on high, longer than I would have without the cream, until soft peaks formed.  At that time, I poured it over the other mixture.  Baking took an additional 20 minutes past the time in the recipe, until the middle was nearly set... nonetheless, the result was beautiful, with zero cracking.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by how great this turned out. Much more like a cheesecake than a pie. I made the following adjustments: 2 and 1/2 packages of cream cheese, 3/4 cup sugar, a heaping cup of pumpkin, 1 tsp vanilla and 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice. I made my own graham cracker crust in a deep dish pie plate. I put a scant 2 cups of the cream cheese mixture in the first layer and mixed the pumpkin with the remaining mixture for the top layer. It took at least an hour to bake. I took it out when it was just a little jiggly in the middle but firm on the edges. It did crack but I don't really mind that. Delicious!

text:
This is a really good and easy recipe. I made the crust from one of the other recipes here and it went very well with this pumpkin dessert. My advice---DO NOT BUY THE ALLSPICE pumpkin!!

Use each one of the spices it asks for individually!! It makes such a difference. That pumpkin all spice stuff is not very good. I made one with and one without. NOBODY liked the allspice one. Said it tasted fake.

That's the beauty of working with spices. 

Anyways--I am not a fan of pumpkin but I did try this and it was yummy!!! Not too cheesecakey-not too pumpkiny. 
A good balance of both.

country:
None
text:
Great recipe. Came here to share a tip that can be used with all cheesecakes--

Bake one cheesecake at a time, on the middle rack, and put a shallow glass dish 1/3 full of water on the rack below it.
Superfats the 'skim' layer with water and keeps your cheesecake from cracking during the last 10 minute and during the refrigeration process. Refrigeration removes moisture from the air, and that's the cause of the infernal perfect cheesecake cracking.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2014-11-28T12:37:35.917

0
userID:
3835516
Display Name:
proudmomma
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0

0

3

203

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made cheesecake before and so after reading all the reviews, I went for the adjustments to get more pumpkin flavor and cheesecake texture. The result was perfection on the first try! I used a regular cake pan and it still worked out fine. (first slice a little tricky though). Check out my crack free cheesecake photo with a slice in front. I piped homemade whipped cream and sprinkled cinnamon on top. It looked amazing. PS. I did use almost all organic ingredients just because I prefer it. Here's what I did...

Followed recipe basics, yes I used puree and added spices.

Changes:

-Used about 3/4 to 1 cup of puree and a little more of each spice.

-Increased sugar by adding 1/4 c. more.

-Used 3 packages of cream cheese and 3 eggs at room temperature.

-Folded in 1/2 cup sour cream after beating in each egg. I sat the sour cream out for about 30-40 min. so it wasn't super cold.

-Made my own gram cracker crust. 1 1/2 cups crushed graham cracker crumbs, 1/3 cup whit sugar, 6 tablespoons melted butter. Mix and press to bottom, no need to prebake.

-Poured about half of white batter on the bottom to achieve more of a pronounced cheesecake layer.

-Baked for 1 hour at 350 in water bath that went half way up side of pan. (I placed my pan in a rectangle glass dish filled with water).

-After the hour, I opened the oven part way and let in cool down in there for another hour. Finally, it sat on the counter for 30 minutes before it went in the refrigerator over night.

SCRUMPTIOUS!

text:
I have been using this recipe since about 2002, when I made my first thanksgiving dinner. I do some small changes though. I always save a little of the cream cheese filling in a snack bag to help decorate the top once I add the pumpkin mixture. I also put more like 3/4 cup of pumpkin, a little brown sugar, cinnamon, and pumpkin spice in the mixture. When the pie has about 10-15 minutes to finish cooking, I pull it out and add a pecan streusel around the outer edges. I let it cook the rest of the way and cool as instructed. I also don't use any whipped cream. Thanks so much for this recipe, my family and friends will not let me enter any holiday gathering without the pie in my hands!

text:
Made for the first time today. I didn't change a single ingredient, however, I used a "Cheesecake Moat" to augment the baking process.the moat is a pan within a pan. You put boiling water in the moat. It adds a deeper consistent penetrating heat while keeping moisture in the air. The pie was done in thirty five minutes. Our guests couldn't believe that I made it at six this morning. It is simple and provides a fantastic dessert for family and guests.

Use all the ingredients listed but use regular pumpkin pie filling instead of puree. That punches up the taste to another level. I like Polar pumpkin pie filling but at times it is hard to find. city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made a change with the crust when I tried this recipe (my husband and I don't like graham cracker crust).  So, what I did was set my oven to 425 degrees then use my traditional crust, rolled out, floured the pie pan, laid the crust out, cut the excess, pinch the edges and poke holes in the bottom with a fork.  Then I make the filling according to the above recipe, layers and all.  After getting the second layer on I place the pie in the oven for 10 minutes.  When my timer sounds I turn the oven down to the 325 degrees it calls for and cook for the additional 30 minutes.  Test with a toothpick and viola!  Pumpkin Cheesecake out of the oven to cool and you look like you spent all day!

Love this recipe! I personally HATE pumpkin pie, and this past Thanksgiving was asked to bring a pumpkin and apple pie (I made the grandma Ople apple pie which is amazing!) Since I hate pumpkin pie so much I thought, I'll see if I can find an alternative to that boring old pie! Then I found this. Store bought or home made, the crust goes so well with the pumpkin and cream cheese filling. The high school boys fought over who got the last slice and now I make it for them when they get straight As on their progress reports and report cards. I've made this several times and the only change I have made is using pumpkin pie spice in place of the cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg, but I only do that because I don't have cloves or nutmeg and have a ton of PPS.

Happy eating!

text:
Made this cheesecake yesterday with the help of my 9 year old son and it was absolutely amazingly insanely delicious!!! Better than most store bought cheesecakes, no doubt.  And this is the first time I ever baked or made a cheesecake. We did have a few minor adjustments.  We did not have a prepared graham cracker crust, but we did have graham cracker crumbs so we made our own crust following instructions on the box (easy and delicious!).  Also, added 1/2 cup light brown sugar to the pumpkin portion of the cheesecake and skipped nutmeg and cloves as my son does not like those. :) It did take a little longer than 35-40 minutes to bake, but that is probably because our oven is older. Other than that, followed this recipe step by step, and voila! The cheesecake was mostly gone in 30 minutes! :) We will be making it again next weekend.  Thank you for posting this recipe!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was a hit - I made it into cheesecake bars.  I made the graham cracker crust I recipe from this site and doubled it.  I used about 3/4+ to make a 1/4 inch layer in a glass 9x13 pan and baked as directed, but for 11 min.  Then doubled this cheesecake recipe and followed exactly for a doubled recipe and poured on top of cooled crust.  Baked at 325 for about 50-55 min when outer 2 edges were set and the inside jiggled slightly.  Let cool on the counter and then finisehd cooling in the fridge.  Then cut into bars.

text:
I've made this pie every thanksgiving and people never eat any of the other pie available because  its so good. Some hints: use a large double layer crust because the normal ones don't fit all the batter, use a blender to mix after every step to decrease lumps,  bake in a water bath (optional it helps so the crust isn't too dark), don'the open the oven too much  while baking the reduce cracks. I also like to freeze it for a couple hours to set, and I cover it with cool whip and sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

country:
None
text:
This was absolutely delicious. I didn't make any changes other than to make 1.5 times the filling and using two prepared graham cracker crusts. I found that doing this left me with just a bit of canned pure pumpkin, so I went ahead and used the remainder of it in the filling and added an extra dash of the spices to accompany it. The texture of the cheesecake was light yet creamy at the same time, and I had no problems with cracking. I placed a pan of water on the bottom rack just to be safe. When the timer went off, I checked them then turned the oven off and left the cheesecakes for about 15 minutes. When I removed them, they were perfectly set and beautiful. Everyone at my church was impressed with this dessert! Thanks for a keeper that will be added to the Autumn rotation!

text:
Giving it 4 because I used this recipe as my inspiration... I've been making double layer pumpkin  cheesecake for years now and it's everyone's first holiday request.  I double the ingredients, use canned pumpkin pie mix, and make a home made gingersnap crust. I use my spring form pan.  Done this way, it looks professional.  It's taller and thicker and when you slice it you can see the contrast between the dark crust, white layer and orange pumpkin on top... it's very pretty and just as delicious!

text:
Made this twice already. It is delicious! The first time I made it, I only had one package of cream cheese, so I improvised and added a little sour cream to add volume. The batter was also a little runny because of that and I ended up creating a marbled pumpkin layer (it wouldn't stay as a separate layer). Nonetheless, this was a FANTASTIC way to enjoy both pumpkin pie and cheesecake at the same time. Love it, thanks for sharing!

userID:
4961376
Display Name:
HappyChef
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0

1

49
recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/417153.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I did something more chocolate-y!  I used Philadelphia CHOCOLATE Cream Cheese.  I basically divided the recipe in half.  For the first cream cheese layer, I used 1 egg, 1/4c (4 tbsp) sugar, 1/4 tsp vanilla extract and 250g Chocolate Cream Cheese. Creamed everything together and placed in a pie crust.  For the pumpkin cheesecake layer, I wanted more pumpkin flavour so I used less regular cream cheese and more pumpkin. I modified using only 3/4 portion of a package of cream cheese along with 1 egg, 1/4c of sugar and 1/4tsp vanilla. Then I used 3/4c of pumpkin puree along 3/4tsp of pumpkin spice and 1/2tsp of cinnamon because I like mine more cinnamon-y!  I baked it a bit longer since I had more pumpkin maybe by 5-10 mins.  It was a big hit with the chocolate layer especially!  Everyone thought it tasted like chocolate pudding!  I also used real Oreo cookie crumbs dividing the two layers and a chocolate graham crust and it was sooo good!

text:
Delicious! I modified the recipe a bit and put it in a springform pan. I used 2 packages of cream cheese and one 300g package of ricotta, 3 eggs, 3/4 cup sugar and 1 cup of pumpkin puree. I also changed the spices up a bit, I used 2 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp ginger and 1 tsp ground cloves. For the crust I used 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs, 6 tbsp butter, 1/2 tsp ground ginger and a pinch of salt.

text:
I just tried this recipe for the first time. It was so easy to make! All of the ingredients were on hand. (I love recipes where you can find most, if not all of the ingredients in your kitchen and don't have to go out just to get the one or two items that you'll rarely use for other recipes.)
I followed this recipe exactly. I baked it for the lesser of the suggested times. At 35 minutes the pie came out a tad dry. but my family gobbled it up saying they didn't notice it being dry. I'll bake it for 30 minutes next time. And there will be a next time! It's a simple, yet impressive (two layers!, delicious cheese cake pie. It gets a five! The dryness could be attributed to oven temperament,weather, (it was raining) or altitude (sea level).Thanks for sharing the recipe!

text:
My family loved this.  It is so easy and so delicious.  This one is a keeper.  I followed the advice of other reviewers and used more cream cheese and added 1 cup sugar, and 1/3 cup sour cream. The texture was great and even with a deep dish pie crust, there was enough filling left for a second pie.  I did add enough of the cream cheese mixture for at least an inch for the first layer. I think that makes it more interesting.  I also used pre-made pumpkin pie filling, the whole can.  It was great.  Will definately be making this again.

country:

text:
So much tastier than your average pumpkin pie.  I added 4 oz cream cheese to beef up the 1st layer a bit.  Poured 1 and a half cups in the pie crust, then put it int he freezer while I mixed up the remaining ing.  I went a but heavy on the spices and pumkin as another reviewer suggested.  When I 1st tasted the pumpkin mixture I was worried- it wasn't great on its own- thought I went overboard on the spices but the end result was fantastic.  i think the cream cheese layer is meant to mellow the flavor of the pumpkin layer.  This went over really well at Thanksgiving.  Will definitely make again. Edit 11/2016- make this the Tuesday before Thanksgiving= that's the perfect amount of time for the flavors to come together. Use the bigger pie crust and beef up the cream cheese layer with an additional 4oz cc and add extra pumpkin and seasoning (easy on the nutmeg.  Top with cool whip and sprinkle with cinnamon.

userID:

Display Name:
Bridgett Leah Davis

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3039786.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Instead of a tired old graham cracker crust, I used the recipe on here for Molasses Sugar Cookies-placed the cookie dough in the bottom of my pan and baked for about 10 minutes. When I pulled the pan out of the stove I had the cream cheese layer ready to pour in, placed my pan back in the oven for 10 more minutes while I readied the pumpkin layer.  Once the pumpkin layer is in, I allow the cheesecake to bake undisturbed until the center doesn't appear glossy anymore. As soon as that sheen disappears I cut the oven off, allow the cheesecake to sit 10 more minutes then remove. We could care less about cracking, but it's minimal anyway. The molasses sugar cookie crust makes this cheesecake over-the-top and compliments the pumpkin beautifully.

It was a huge hit and this will be on my menu every year! This cheesecake was delicious! I made it in an 8" cheesecake pan so The only negative was there wasn't enough batter. I also used 1 cup of pumpkin instead. Next time i will double the recipe. I prefer to make my own crust with 1 pkg smashed graham crackers and 3/4 stick melted butter. It's more cost effective and you never have to worry about the crust breaking as with the premade ones. Just go buy a cheesecake pan if you like making cheesecake!

text:
My new go-to take along for holiday gatherings!  Just be sure not to undercook the cake.  I undercooked my first one and it was a goopy mess (still tasted good, though).  Since I wasn't sure what was meant by "the center is almost set," I use the springy to the touch rule.  If none sticks to your finger and it feels a bit like a cooked warm cupcake, it will be be good.

country:

text:
Tried this, was my very first cheesecake.  The only issue I had was I added a whole can of pumpkin (i really love my pumpkin flavors) and the outsides of the pie was thick, just the way it should be, but the middle was still gooey.  Baked it the full 40 mins, and refrigerated it 4 hours before consuming.  The next day the middle was a bit more thicker, but not by much.  Still loved the flavors though!  Didn't use cloves or nutmeg, pretty much used the cinnamon and a pinch of pumpkin pie spice.  Also found a difference recipe for the crust, which turned out amazing!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I didn't have a spring form pan so I improvised and used cupcake tins, they're not the typical size - slightly smaller but not as small as a mini muffin tin would be. Anywho, I also didn't have a crust, so I used store brand cinnamon graham crackers (that I pulverized with a crude little 'underside of a small flat bowl' trick :D ) mixed with butter - lined the bottom of the cups with that and proceeded with the recipe. They came out AMAZING. I brought a tray to work with a can of whipped cream and a bottle of chocolate syrup - they were all gone by lunch time! I will ABSOLUTELY be using this recipe again. It was simple, creative and looked like it took far more effort and much longer than it did in reality. Work smarter, not harder! My kinda recipe!

ari3189

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674149.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is AMAZING. I read many of the reviews before making it and followed the suggestions of others and used an extra 8oz block of cream cheese and about 3/4 of a can of pumpkin. For the spices, at first I used the amount the recipe calls for but it was a little bland and very pumpkiny so I added a little more of all the spices. I did not bake in a water bath so it did crack a lot while cooking (which took about an hour), but who cares it still tastes the same! My boyfriend and I were getting antsy to try it so we put it in the freezer for a couple hours to speed up the cooling process and it turned out so good! I also made a caramel sauce to drizzle on top (from food network titled "easy caramel sauce" - it's delish). My boyfriend took one bite and said, "This is f***ing amazing. I am speechless." WIN!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This "cheesecake" was pretty good. It did taste a lot more like a cream cheese pie then. I did what a lot of people mentioned and used pumpkin pie 'mix' which is basically filling, I did use a little less then 1/2 cup of sugar, and half of the seasonings since its already seasoned, but i wanted a little extra spice. Its really hard to blend completely smooth so mine DID end up getting clumps in it, make sure you blend it really well. I didn't get much of a "layered" affect either, but that didn't matter. It took 3 hours to solidify enough to cut. The flavor, texture, and crust was really good. Overall, 5 stars.

text:
Made this with Graham Cracker Crust I (recipe found on allrecipes) and family LOVED it.  The only changes made were I put about 2 cups of the plain cheesecake mix on the bottom and added about another 1/2 cup - 1 cup of pumpkin for the top layer, but that was a personal preference.  I REALLY wanted a cheesecake bottom with more of a pumpkin pie topping.  Served with whipped cream, and family absolutely LOVED it!!! Only complaint is that it is really rich and heavy after a big meal, but was a very nice day after Thanksgiving leftovers!!! Thank you!!!!!!

text:
I made it like a few of the other reviews recommended - with an extra 8oz of cream cheese, extra pumpkin pie filling, and 1/2 C of sour cream.  I made a graham cracker crust and put it in a springform pan, which I wrapped with tin foil before putting it in the water bath.  I've never made a cheesecake before so was just following instructions for that part.  The cheesecake floated in the pan, which I thought was weird, and despite two layers of tin foil it leaked water onto the filling.  It's cooking now (without the water bath) so it remains to be seen if this can be salvaged.  Does anyone have any suggestions for making sure the water doesn't leak in?  I was doing so well up to that point!!

text:
I have a lot of family members on weight watchers, so I always look for modifications without losing the taste. I used 1/2 Splenda and 1/2 sugar, made my own crust with reduced fat graham crackers, and used neufchatel cheese, and it still tasted fabulous! I also kept a pan of water below the cheesecake while baking. I baked for closer to 50 minutes. Was a huge hit and will be making this one over and over again!

I thought the cheese layer was quite heavy and dense, had good flavour though, perfect for introducing a pumpkin flavoured dessert to people that haven't had pumpkin pie before.

userID:
3829535
Display Name:
Windee-girl
isPro:

6

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614252.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was fantastic!  And not difficult at all!  The pumpkin flavor is great, not overwhelming.  And the creaminess...my family loved it!  Also, it was beautiful.  I had no issues with cracking.  Just be sure not to overbeat it. I made mine in regular 9-in pie pans, which is not ideal, but it worked out just fine.  Here's a tip: I made two this time, and I only had one pan to do a water bath.  The one that sat directly on the oven rack turned out nicely, and tasted great, but had a lump here or there on the surface.  The one in the water bath, however, was had a flawless surface and texture (in comparison with the other one).  Use a water bath - it's easy and it makes a significant difference.  Great recipe - I'll be using it again.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2009-12-21T06:33:29.727

This was fantastic!  I followed the advice of some others and used Libby's pumpkin pie filling rather than plain puree + spices.  I also added an additional 8 oz. pkg of cream cheese, and made a homemade graham cracker crust rather than a prepared crust.  I put the batter in a food processor to get out all lumps and air pockets, and baked it in a water bath.  It was so smooth and creamy, I got tons of compliments on Thanksgiving!

text:
I used pumpkin pie mix to aviod having to buy spices, which made the top a little sweeter. By far the best cheesecake I've ever made( well, this is my second) but I was disappointed in the lack of pumpkin-ness. Maybe 3/4 cup of pumpkin instead? Yeah, I got cracks, but they don't bother me...as long as it tastes good. What made it special was that I used a homemade gingersnap crust and served with sliced mangoes. Be careful when blending the cheese...when I stuck the blender in the two blocks, the two beaters broke from their attachment points...man, I wish I had a KitchenAid.

text:
I thought the intensities of the flavors needed to be kicked up a bit.  The cheesecake didn't have the intense almost-pucker-your-mouth cheesecake flavor, nor did the pumpkin have the rich pumpkin pie taste of holiday pie.   So this recipe did not reach excellence in either taste, but it was still tasty.  I will not make it again, however.  I used room temp cream cheese and eggs.  I increased the amount of vanilla to 1 t. and in addition to the 1/2 cup of sugar, I added 2 T.- 3 T. more sugar.

photo:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was incredible!!  At first glance it seems intimidating and a bit difficult, but it was super simple. I brought this over to my boyfriend's parents house for Thanksgiving and everyone loved it.  His mother even asked me to make it for a family event this weekend :)  I made this recipe a bit healthier by using 3 boxes of 1/3 less fat philadelphia cream cheese, substituted splenda granulated for white sugar, egg beaters instead of whole eggs and used sugar free cool whip.  I also took another reviewer's advice and added 1 1/2 cups of the cream cheese mixture instead of 1 cup and baked for 1 hour.  After 1 hour, I turned off the oven and propped the oven door open for another hour to cool and to prevent cracking.  Thank you for a great recipe I'll be making again and again!  Pictures to follow :)

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I was so excited about this recipe but I live in Japan so things are a bit different.  They sell cream cheese (expensive cream cheese) in 200g blocks and this recipe calls for 450g so I only used 2 blocks (400g) instead.  I don't know if that is why, but it was a bit too sweet.  It was very easy to make and I had a good time making it with my 4 year old.  I would like to try it again with less sugar and see how it turns out.  Since there is no canned pumpkin here in Japan (not that I have seen anyway) I usually use fresh kabocha squash however I had a bunch of acorn squash that I had never tried before and my wife was reluctant to use for anything so I used them.  One acorn squash was enough but the color is a little less than desirable.  The acorn squash left some barely noticeable stringy fibers but no one in my group noticed them.
