text:
This was a very good recipe.  I am not a huge fan of pumpkin but this was a delicious cheesecake.  It was a big hit for Thanksgiving and was not overly sweet.   I did do as other reviewers have posted and took out 1 1/2 cups of the cream cheese mixture for the bottom layer.  Then for the second layer added a bit more pumpkin puree (maybe 1/3 cup).  It turned out great.   After cooking, let cool in the oven for a while, then with the oven door cracked just a bit.  I did not have any problems with the cheesecake cracking.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Absolutely wonderful!!! I followed the advice of SOUTHERNBELLE0908 and used 3 8oz packages of cream cheese instead of 2, added 1/2 cup of sour cream (Fold the sour cream in after adding the eggs),increased the pumpkin puree to 1 8oz can and added a bit more nutmeg & Cinnamon. Bake in a water bath at 350 for 1 hr (till the middle jiggles like jello), turn off oven, prop the door open and let the cheesecake sit for another hour then refrigerate. Use a 10in springform pan and shortbread cookie crust. Use  caramel sauce & pour over the cheesecake. You will not regret it if you make this recipe it is amazing!!!

text:
I normally make cheese cakes in a springform pan.  This was SO easy and quick.  We had about 5 pies this Thanksgiving and this one was the first to be goggled up.  I wipped it up the night before in no time.  I did use the graham cracker premade crust.  However I used over 1 C. of the Libby's Pumpkin Pie filling only added a dash of extra cinnamon.  I also bought the individual size premade graham crusts and and I got 1 full size pie and 5 small crusts (so the kids got their own pie) They thought that was so cool.  I baked the small ones for 35 min. but the 9" pie took 55 min.  I used Hershey's Dulce de Leche carmel topping and drizzled it over the pie and then topped with whipped topping and a pinch of cinnamon for show.  It looked like it came from a fancy restaurant and it was so good!  This is defintly a keeper!  I had to send out the recipe to several relatives.

userID:
1247843
Display Name:
Dawn Herbert
isPro:
False
followersCount:
7

46

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1338760.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Thanks so much for sharing this recipe! We really enjoyed it. I did adapt it to fit a springform pan. I used the Graham Cracker Crust 1 from this site. I made one batch of cream cheese, white sugar, vanilla and eggs as written in the recipe for the bottom layer. Then I made another batch and added the pumpkin and spices to it for the top layer. For a pinch I used 1/4 teaspoons. I accidentally added 1/4 tsp of ginger. I used 3/4 can of pumpkin, but next time I think I should use the whole can. I also made sure that my eggs, cream cheese, and mixing bowl were at room temperature. I baked it at 250 for 90 minutes, turned off oven and opened the door. I let it sit for an hour, and it came out beautiful! No cracks. No water bath. I let it cool completely before I put it in the fridge. I chilled overnight. Don't forget to run a knife around the edge of the pan before taking springform side off. It turned out very thick and rich, so serve it in small pieces. (They can always get seconds.) It is great for serving a crowd. For Thanksgiving it took care of my cheesecake and pumpkin pie craving.

text:
wow awesome! thank youu! couple changes and things to add.
if you follow this recipe you might have a little extra filling but thats ok. i made 3 pies. first pie i used 3 packages of 8 ounce creame cheese and 1/3 cup of sour cream and i had extra filling so i filled half of another pie shell. on the first crust i bought a pre made graham craker crust but drizzled it with butter and put crushed giner snaps on it. then i did the regular layer then then pumpkin layer..cooked it for about 45 mintures in a water bath. came out a little undercooked but once i put it in the fridge good to go. i sprinkled graham cracker and ginger snap crumb on the top. for the second pie i used a vanialla wafter crust with the same butter drizzle graham cracker and gingersnap bottom. i reduced the amout of cream cheese to 2 packages and added a little less sourcream. after i did the regular layer of the cake i did a think layer of the crust before i put the pumpkin layer one it. i had a little extra too so i topped of the 3rd pie from the early extra filling. i again sprinkled the mixture of the crust and inside layer on top and covered with homemade whip cream and sprinkled pumpkin spice on it. the 3rd pie was just pumpkin cheesecake from the leftover filling with a chocolate crust. i cooked the 2nd too about 45 mintues and they were just right. and then i let them cool on the rack and then put them in the frige until serving time. my family ate some of the first pie, i gave away the chocolate crus

Wow, good.  Sweet n' spicy, I loved it.  Makes a lot of mix so if you wanted to make a deep dish 10 inch you could.  Used more pumpkin mix than called for to give more flavor, also used more of the spices than called for, for same reason.  Could try less sugar, but this amount was very good. This was excellent!  My husband and I absolutely loved it.  I did make a few modifications to make it 'lighter'.  I used 1 8 oz. fat free cream cheese and 1 8 oz. 1/3 cream cheese. Great recipe and w/o a lot of fat.  We surely enjoy...thank you!

text:
I used  pre-made graham cracker crust, (3) 8 oz containers of  fat free cream cheese, with half for the cream cheese mixture (also added 2 extra tbsp sugar, 1 tsp of vanilla, and 1 tsp cinnamon before splitting it off)  and half with canned pumpkin. I took off a star because I think with an extra 8 oz of cream cheese you need to adjust the pumpkin (which I didn't). This made it REALLY cream cheesey. I would use 1 cup of the pumpkin pie filling next time. Also, don't try sneaking a bite before it's been refrigerated overnight. I did and honestly it tasted terrible. Next day it was WAY tastier! Easy recipe, thanks for sharing!

Excellent. This was the hit of the Thanksgiving dinner. It replaced the pumpkin pie and was requested for next year! I made the following changes: I used a homemade graham cracker crust, used canned pumpkin, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp cloves, 1/2 tsp nutmeg and I baked it for 50 minutes. I also left it in the oven to cool after it was done baking.

userID:
2003593
Display Name:
Korrine
isPro:
False
followersCount:
2
followingCount:
0

25

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/2352.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent cheesecake!  I gave the recipe 4 stars instead of 5 b/c I didn't follow the recipe exactly.  I can't ever leave a recipe well enough alone. :o)  I made my own crust using cinnamon graham crackers & pressed it into a 10-in springform pan.  I also added an extra 4 oz. cream cheese and an extra egg to the batter, plus an extra 1/2 c. pumpkin to the pumpkin layer, in addition to using pumkin pie filling with extra spices rather than just pumpkin puree.

My cheesecake cracked something fierce (didn't have anything big enough to stick it in for baking in a water bath), so I ended up making Cinnamon Cream Syrup (from this site) and pouring over the top to disguise the cracks.  It looked a little bland, so I crushed some butter toffees and sprinkled the crumbs over all.  The cheescake was spectacular, and the added toppings were just guilding the lily, so to speak.  This recipe (or my version of it) will be on my holiday menu from now on!
Review:
Rating:

text:
Excellent cheesecake!  I gave the recipe 4 stars instead of 5 b/c I didn't follow the recipe exactly.  I can't ever leave a recipe well enough alone. :o)  I made my own crust using cinnamon graham crackers & pressed it into a 10-in springform pan.  I also added an extra 4 oz. cream cheese and an extra egg to the batter, plus an extra 1/2 c. pumpkin to the pumpkin layer, in addition to using pumkin pie filling with extra spices rather than just pumpkin puree.

My cheesecake cracked something fierce (didn't have anything big enough to stick it in for baking in a water bath), so I ended up making Cinnamon Cream Syrup (from this site) and pouring over the top to disguise the cracks.  It looked a little bland, so I crushed some butter toffees and sprinkled the crumbs over all.  The cheescake was spectacular, and the added toppings were just guilding the lily, so to speak.  This recipe (or my version of it) will be on my holiday menu from now on!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
One of the best cheesecakes I've ever had!  I followed the advice of some here and used 3 bricks of cheescake, plus 1/4 cup more sugar.  I also toasted some pecan pieces in a saute pan with sugar, and sprinkled half of them over the bottom of the pie crust before adding the cheesecake mixture, then the rest of them over the top layer. We were also baking a pumpkin pie, so I had to remove this from the oven right away and let it cool on the stove top.  I didn't bake it in a water bath, either, and was worried it would crack badly.  Despite these two things, it hardly cracked at all.  Everyone loved it.  I'll be making it for everyone for holiday gifts.  Thanks!

text:
This was very good - used a ginger cookie crust (Anna's Ginger Thins - crust was awesome!) and doubled everything and used a 9" springform pan.  I basically split the batter in half and used half plain for the bottom layer and mixed the pumpkin and spices into the other half, and got two perfect thick layers.  Took about 50 minutes to bake, then turned the oven off and left it until cool.  Very attractive and tasted good too (I even used low-fat cream cheese)

userID:
1499819
Display Name:
propsero
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
2
favoritesCount:
0
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614260.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the best thanksgiving dessert I have ever made by far. I made the following adjustments: per the directions on the crust packaging, I brushed the crust with one egg and baked by itself for about 5 minutes at 425. This gave the crust an even richer taste. Per other comments here, I used a pumpkin pie filling can rather than pumpkin puree. I still did add some additional ground cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon, about 1/2 t each, and will actually do more next time, I like the spice. My cooking time was significantly longer than the 35-40 minutes listed in the recipe: I used the "jiggle test" until it acted like set jello, and that took at least 55 minutes (I was cooking 2 pies in a small oven). Another reviewer here suggested turning off the oven at the end of the cooking time, and slightly propping the door open to stop the cheesecake from cracking. I have no idea if that made a difference, but I did that for about 45 minutes and it did not crack at all. Instead of whipped topping I made the glaze in the recipe from this site called "Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze" with lots of added cinnamon and put it on the cheesecake after the 45 minute in-oven cooling period. That was a perfect addition, it really made it a 3-layer cake. I recommend serving this cake straight from the refrigerator, it is great very cold.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2007-11-21T15:36:06.467

text:
This is the best thanksgiving dessert I have ever made by far. I made the following adjustments: per the directions on the crust packaging, I brushed the crust with one egg and baked by itself for about 5 minutes at 425. This gave the crust an even richer taste. Per other comments here, I used a pumpkin pie filling can rather than pumpkin puree. I still did add some additional ground cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon, about 1/2 t each, and will actually do more next time, I like the spice. My cooking time was significantly longer than the 35-40 minutes listed in the recipe: I used the "jiggle test" until it acted like set jello, and that took at least 55 minutes (I was cooking 2 pies in a small oven). Another reviewer here suggested turning off the oven at the end of the cooking time, and slightly propping the door open to stop the cheesecake from cracking. I have no idea if that made a difference, but I did that for about 45 minutes and it did not crack at all. Instead of whipped topping I made the glaze in the recipe from this site called "Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze" with lots of added cinnamon and put it on the cheesecake after the 45 minute in-oven cooling period. That was a perfect addition, it really made it a 3-layer cake. I recommend serving this cake straight from the refrigerator, it is great very cold.

I've made this twice for people who thought my only cooking knowledge was pouring milk into a cereal bowl. Then after my husband brags that I made this they look astonished! I would spring for the brand name cream cheese though, as when I used a generic the second time I had lumps that would not go away.

text:
This is a perfect Thanksgiving/Fall dessert.  In search for a recipe that was not overly sweet, it hit the spot.  I made a double batch as I had two dinners in a row.  Per other reviewers' advice, I  increased the bottom cream cheese layer  to balance the flavours.  Also substituted splenda for the sugar.  Top with 'real whipped cream' spray for a nice presentation and ease!  I was surprised at the compliments from guests!  Will be making this again this weekend for the next dinner party.
